io.odysz.semantics

Interface IUser


  • public interface IUser

    Provide user e.g. servlet session information to modify some data in AST.

    Usage

    1. Configure the implementations class name in config.xml.
    2. If the client needing logging in and responsed with a user object, the class must extend SemanticObject.
    - For default implementation, see semantic.jserv/JUser.

    This is not necessary if using semantic-transact directly. But if the caller want to set user information like fingerpirnt for modified records, this can be used to let semantic-transact providing user identity to the semantics handler.

    In v1.1.1, sessionId is read only. If a new password have been updated, just remove then re-login

    Author:
    ody

    • Method Detail

      • meta

        TableMeta meta()
        Provide DB table meta for managing session by AnSession.
        Returns:
        table meta

      • dbLog

        default ArrayList<String> dbLog(ArrayList<String> sqls)
                         throws TransException

        The sqls is committed to database, do something for logging. If there are some operation needing to update db, return those sql statements.

        If the parameter sqls is returned, it will be committed again because the semantic connection is think it's the logging sql.

        Make sure the committed sqls is not returned, only logging sqls are needed.
        Parameters:
        sqls -
        Returns:
        SQLs for logging, null for nothing to do
        Throws:
        TransException

      • login

        default boolean login(Object request)
               throws TransException
        Check user log in (already has pswd, iv and user Id from db)
        Parameters:
        request - request object. In sematic.jserv, it's SessionReq object.
        Returns:
        true: ok; false: failed
        Throws:
        TransException - Checking login information failed

      • guessPswd

        default boolean guessPswd(String pswdCypher64,
                          String iv64)
                   throws TransException,
                          GeneralSecurityException,
                          IOException
        If a user is allowed to change password, this is used to verify old and must be overriden to check the old password cipher.
        Parameters:
        pswdCypher64 - decrypted with my token id
        iv64 -
        Returns:
        yes or no
        Throws:
        TransException
        IOException
        GeneralSecurityException

      • sessionId

        default IUser sessionId(String rad64num)

      • sessionId

        default String sessionId()
        A session Id can never be changed. If a new password been updated, just remove the session and re-login.
        Returns:
        the session token

      • touch

        default IUser touch()

        Update last touched time stamp.

        FYI, if the session object will be terminated when time is out, this method must touch the current time to keep session alive.

        Note: science v1.3.5, this requires users implement a touch function, and return the instance.

        Since:
        1.3.5

      • touchedMs

        long touchedMs()
        Last touched time in milliseconds, set by touch().

      • uid

        String uid()
        user id

      • onCreate

        default IUser onCreate(io.odysz.anson.Anson sessionReqBody)
                throws GeneralSecurityException

        Since v1.4.11, user object has a chance to initialize with Semantic.DA AnResultset. e.g. setting client device Id which is essential to doc synchronizing.

        Since v1.3.5, user object has a chance to initialize with login request.

        Parameters:
        sessionReqBody - e.g. AnSessionReq
        Returns:
        Throws:
        SsException
        GeneralSecurityException
